Welcome!

Welcome to the SoCal Digital Practice Resources Page! Here you will find resources specific to our office studio including helpful bookmarks, training, links to key firm resources, and much more.

Bill Zahurak

Digital Practice Manager
Digital Practice
Digital Practice Onboarding

SoCal Digital Practice Onboarding

SoCal Revit Training Recordings

Digital Practice Core Exchange Q1 2026


This quarter’s Digital Practice Core eXchange will take place during the week of January 19, beginning Tuesday in observance of the U.S. Monday holiday. The series supports knowledge sharing across the firm and offers AIA continuing education credits.

We’re kicking off the year with a “Back to Basics” theme, continuing from the October series. Sessions will focus on Perkins&Will workflows, including the Hub Overview, Area Sync, Pull Planning, CCA, Conceptual/SD Design, and Teams + SharePoint. Additional sessions include Project Performance Annual Review*, Overview of Biobased and Natural Materials*, Foundations of Accessibility in Design*, Digital Strategy, and Innovation Incubator*.

All sessions will be recorded and posted to the Digital Practice site as both videos and slide decks following the event.

Click on any session below to receive the calendar invite for the Teams meeting.

*indicated possible HSW credit

Digital Practice Core Exchange Q4 2025


This quarter’s lineup features a dynamic mix of topics, including returning sessions on Revit Addins at Perkins&Will, Being on Schedule in Revit, and Microsoft Teams Folder Linking.  We also have a few new learning opportunities around Avail, Code Compliance Workflows in Revit, and Annual Project Performance Reviews joining the mix.

New to this Core eXchange is a week long theme session centering on Back to the Basics.  During these 2pm Eastern sessions, we will be refocusing on the essential tools we use everyday – Revit, Rhino, Area Sync, Visualization, and Documentation/Publishing.  These sessions are meant to be a primer on how we use each of these platforms at Perkins&Will and are tailored to both new design staff and designers re-emerging from CCA and wanting to refamiliarize themselves with the tools we use.

Click on any session below to receive the calendar invite for the Teams meeting.
